## 1. What have countries listed as formal definition?

\caption{\label{tab:analyse-question-1}Question 1.1 Responses from Countries that answered 'Yes' to Question 1}\\
\toprule
Country & Response\\
\midrule
Australia & The Australian Government uses the following definition in its Evaluation Toolkit - 'Evaluation is the systematic and objective assessment of the design, implementation or results of a government program or activity for the purposes of continuous improvement, accountability and decision-making. It provides a structured and disciplined analysis of the value of policies, programs and activities at all stages of the policy cycle.' Individual line ministries in the Australian Government use different variations on this definition to suit the individual circumstances of the ministry.\\
Austria & Federal Organic Budget Act 2013; Sec 18 https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/Dokument.wxe?Abfrage=Erv\&Dokumentnummer=ERV\_2009\_1\_139  Secondary Legislation: Para 11: https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/GeltendeFassung.wxe?Abfrage=Bundesnormen\&Gesetzesnummer=20008150\\
Canada & Evaluation is the systematic and neutral collection and analysis of evidence to judge merit, worth or value.   Evaluations: • inform decision making, improvements, innovation and accountability; • focus on programs, policies and priorities, but, depending on user needs, can also examine other units, themes and issues, including alternatives to existing interventions; • examine questions related to relevance, effectiveness and efficiency; and • employ social science research methods\\
Chile & The regulatory framework provided by the Decree 2.068 of 2022 includes the definition of the different ex post evaluation  types: 1) Evaluation of Public Programs (EPG); 2) Impact Evaluation (EI); 3) Focused Scope Evaluation (EFA); Sectorial Evaluation (ES). These evaluations must meet principles of thecnical reliability, relevance and opportunity.  Besides, the Decree 5 of 2022 defines ex ante evaluation and monitoring (evaluación de seguimiento)\\
Colombia & Evaluation is a systematic and objective assessment of an ongoing or completed project, program or policy, its design, implementation and results; to determine the relevance the achievement of objectives, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability. The evaluations obtained information credible and useful, to incorporate the lessons into the decision-making process.\\
\addlinespace
Costa Rica & Mideplan defines evaluation as a systematic evaluation of the design, development, and results of policies, plans, programs, and projects based on a set of established value criteria. This assessment generates evidence-based recommendations to support decision-making and improve public management.\\
Estonia & NA\\
France & Il existe plusieurs définitions car le terme “évaluation” recouvre plusieurs conceptions différentes au sein des administrations publiques et en dehors. Voici quelques-unes des définitions :   DREES (actes du séminaire sur les méthodes d’évaluation des politiques publiques, 2011) : « L’évaluation de l’action publique (politique, programme, dispositif) a pour objet d’en apprécier la valeur au regard de certains critères, comme la pertinence, l’efficacité, l’efficience…, notamment dans le but d’apporter des connaissances pour aider à la décision et éclairer le débat public ». (Annie Fouquet, SFE).  C’est sur la base de cette définition de la Société française d’évaluation (SFE) que les évaluations de politique publique dans le cadre de la MAP (Modernisation de l’action publique, 2012-2017) ont été conduites (memo sur l’évaluation des politiques publiques de la MAP, 2015) : “Les questions évaluatives visent à interroger l’ensemble de la chaîne de valeur d’une action publique à partir des critères évaluatifs standards (efficacité, efficience, cohérence, utilité, pertinence) et des orientations structurantes de la modernisation (simplification, innovation, numérique, ouverture des données, soutenabilité...) ».  Décret du 18 novembre 1998 (no 98-1048) : « L’évaluation d’une politique publique, au sens du présent décret, a pour objet d’apprécier, dans un cadre interministériel, l’efficacité de cette politique en comparant ses résultats aux objectifs assignés et aux moyens mis en œuvre ».  Décret du 22 janvier 1990 (no 90-82) : « L’évaluation d’une politique publique au sens du présent décret a pour objet de rechercher si les moyens juridiques, administratifs ou financiers mis en œuvre permettent de produire les effets attendus de cette politique et d’atteindre les objectifs qui lui sont assignés ».\\
Ireland & Evaluation - The process of systematically assessing an intervention (ex ante or ex post) to determine efficiency and - effectiveness in achieving a stated objective  Definition contained in the Public Spending Code.  The Public Spending Code  is the comprehensive set of expenditure appraisal, Value for Money requirements and related guidance covering all public expenditure gov.ie - The Public Spending Code - https://www.gov.ie/en/publication/public-spending-code/\\
Japan & Government Policy Evaluations Act  Article3 (1) An Administrative Organ must study and acquire information on the Effects of Policy (meaning the effect which a set of activities it carried out or intends to carry out has or is expected to have on the lives of people and/or society and the economy) under its jurisdiction at the appropriate time, and on the basis of such study, evaluate own Policy from the standpoints of necessity, efficiency, effectiveness, or other standpoints as special characteristics that the Policy may require.\\
\addlinespace
Latvia & Evaluation is a set of methods and procedures that the developer of a policy planning document carries out in order to assess the socio-economic impact of the implemented policy.\\
Lithuania & Evaluation is a systematic and objective determination of the suitability, effectiveness, efficiency, usefulness and long-term impact of the planned, executed or completed programs.\\
Mexico & According to the second paragraph of the Annual Program for the Evaluation of Budgetary Programs and Public Policies of the Federal Public Administration for fiscal year 2023, evaluation is the systematic and objective analysis of budgetary programs and public policies, as well as of the Federal Contribution Funds to determine the relevance and achievement of their objectives and goals, as well as their efficiency, effectiveness, quality, results and impact, depending on the type of evaluation carried out. Definition from: www.coneval.org.mx/Evaluacion/NME/Documents/PAE\_2023.pdf\\
Netherlands & https://zoek.officielebekendmakingen.nl/stcrt-2022-19587.html\\
Norway & Evaluation is the systematic collecting of data, analysis and assessment of a planned, ongoing or completed activity, organisation, a policy instrument or a sector. The evaluation of a public policy, for the purposes of this law, is the systematic and reasoned process of generating knowledge, based on the collection, analysis and interpretation of information, aimed at the overall understanding of a public policy, in order to reach an evaluative judgment, based on evidence, regarding its design, implementation and effects.'\\
Switzerland & Les évaluations sont des analyses ciblées et limitées dans le temps, qui visent à cerner le concept, la mise en œuvre et les effets des mesures étatiques, à quantifier, si possible, ces trois aspects et à évaluer jusqu’à quel point ces mesures contribuent à atteindre le but visé et à améliorer le bien-être de la collectivité\\
United Kingdom & Evaluation is a systematic assessment of the design, implementation and outcomes of an intervention. It involves understanding how an intervention is being, or has been, implemented and what effects it has, for whom and why. ### Following is what Claude summarises:

Based on the commonalities across these 19 countries, policy evaluation is: The systematic and objective assessment of government policies, programs, or activities—examining their design, implementation, and results—to determine their effectiveness, efficiency, and impact in achieving intended objectives, with the purpose of informing decision-making, ensuring accountability, and improving public management.

Core elements present across definitions:

-   **Systematic and objective** methodology

-   Assessment of **effectiveness** (achieving objectives) and efficiency (resource use)

-   Focus on **results/outcomes/impacts**

-   Purpose of **decision-making** and **improvement**

-   Evidence-based approach for **accountability**
